title: Combinatorial phenotypic landscape enables bacterial resistance to phage infection.
authors: Gupta A, Morella N, Sutormin D, Li N, Gaisser K, Robertson A, Ispolatov Y, Seelig G, Dey N, Kuchina A
journal: bioRxiv : the preprint server for biology
abstract: Success of phage therapies is limited by bacterial defenses against phages. While a large variety of anti-phage defense mechanisms has been characterized, how expression of these systems is distributed across individual cells and how their combined activities translate into protection from phages has not been studied. Using bacterial single-cell RNA sequencing, we profiled the transcriptomes of ~50,000 cells from cultures of a human pathobiont,
